definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: Judge-made law is called common law.
sentences.chinese: 法官造法就被稱爲普通法。

sentences.english: Some arise from common law. Others are statutory.
sentences.chinese: 它們有些源起於普通法，其他則是屬於成文法。

sentences.english: Free country is the Common-law Rechtsstaat.
sentences.chinese: 自由國傢俱有普通法法治國的形式。

sentences.english: This is a common phenomenon in many common law jurisdictions.
sentences.chinese: 這個現象在許多普通法適用地區亦屬常見。

sentences.english: The law of tort is common-law based.
sentences.chinese: 侵權行爲法以普通法爲基礎。

sentences.english: However, equitable relief regularly will lie only when the common law relief is inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 但是衡平救濟一般是在普通法救濟不足時才得以適用。

sentences.english: American Law belongs to the Common Law legal system which mainly origins from case law.
sentences.chinese: 美國法屬於以判例爲主要法律淵源的普通法法系。

sentences.english: There is a supplementary system of law called equity.
sentences.chinese: 普通法有一個補充的制度，就是衡平法。

sentences.english: Hong Kong has a well-established and trusted legal system based on the common law.
sentences.chinese: 香港擁有完善的和可信賴的法律制度建基於普通法的。

sentences.english: The Common Law Tradition is the congelation of Llewellyn's learning career.
sentences.chinese: 《普通法傳統》是盧埃林三十多年學術生涯的凝結。

sentences.english: In common law countries, judges have the generally accepted authority of interpreting, or construing the law.
sentences.chinese: 在普通法國家，法官有解釋法律的權力。

sentences.english: The UK-US legal system's basic classification is the common law and the balance law.
sentences.chinese: 英美法系的基本分類是普通法和衡平法。

sentences.english: The United States and Germany are the typical representatives of common law system and civil law system respectively.
sentences.chinese: 美國和德國分別是普通法系和大陸法系的典型代表。

sentences.english: Both common-law national and civil-law national devote high attention to this.
sentences.chinese: 無論是普通法系還是大陸法系對此都十分重視。

definition: system of constitutional government/(used as an attributive) constitutional
